website_summaries.verdict: Reliable 8x4 channel performance for DOCSIS 3.0 networks, though modem can run a bit hot under load.
pros: Handles broadband speeds of 100 Mbps and under very reliably
Fairly painless activation through provider with seamless DOCSIS 3.0 compatibility
cons: Web interface is confusing for some users

customer_reviews.title: No complaints here.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this modem a month ago for use with the TWC network and it has worked like a champ. Installed then called TWC and had it up and running in no time. Be forewarned though, if you have TWC as an ISP, when the new speeds roll out in your area this modem will not do over 100/10.You will need a modem with 16x4 channel bonding (this one is 8x4) to get their new Extreme(200/20) and Maxx (300/20) speeds. I have the Turbo tier and get the full 100/10 with this modem.
customer_reviews.author: Korgman

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, easy to install, and works flawlessly = 5 stars!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this modem so I wouldn't have to pay the ridiculous $6/month modem rental fee. Of the models the cable company recommended this was the least expensive so I gave it a shot. Besides registering the MAC with the cable company this device basically plugged in and worked without any issues. Affordable, easy to install, and works flawlessly = 5 stars!
customer_reviews.author: T. Tran

customer_reviews.title: Now Saving $120 a year on Modem rental !
customer_reviews.text: Got this D-Link Docsis 3.0 Modem about $20 less, on a flash deal. Installed for my son to replace the cable company's rented modem. This installed quickly, and the Mediacom remote tech got it connected and running in no time. The internet through speed is greater and increased well over the top speed of the cable company's modem. We now will save the $10 a month rental. So this unit will pay for itself in less than 3 months !
customer_reviews.author: Digster

customer_reviews.title: Good hardware and pays for itself after 6 months (or so)
customer_reviews.text: I have used this with Spectrum (formerly Time Warner Cable) with no issues. This little guy has saved me a $7 a month rental charge. It keeps chugging along with little to no issues. The only issues is every few months I have to power cycle it and my router, but when it comes to these types of electronics, that's pretty normal. Please note: Make sure you check your providers accepted modem list as this might not be supported. I checked Time Warner Cable's list (now Spectrum) and it was approved. Overall it's good hardware and I would recommend. I use it for 50 Mbps internet and have no issues with it keeping up.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew S

customer_reviews.title: Much better than a rental modem from Xfinity
customer_reviews.text: When my Xfinity service was installed, Comcast provided a rental cable modem which was very large and provided other services which are good for Xfinity but don't help the customer. My location was shown incorrectly on maps (I assume at the home of the previous person who rented this modem). After buying the much smaller D-Link DOCSIS modem I took both modems to an Xfinity store, where they registered my new modem and deregistered the rental one. When I returned home I connected the cable and power cord and hit the power button. That's it! After about a half hour of various flashing lights, I was connected to the internet. And my location on maps is now correct.
customer_reviews.author: J. Chaiken

customer_reviews.title: No Frills, Mostly Cheers
customer_reviews.text: Purchased and used for about 3 months now. Nothing fancy, a very light device, with OK stand pieces included. No major complaints, although it feels like our Smart TV (Samsung) has a harder time keeping a stable/strong signal during the peak internet-use hours in our area. It generates some heat, but nothing that seems dangerous so long as the vents are kept clear; recommended to keep it vertical to increase airflow. For the money we save, its a good investment even if we decide to switch to a different ISP. Recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Danio

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, Time Warner Capable Modem
customer_reviews.text: Hooked up with TimeWarner in minutes and works as you'd expect. Haven't tested the 100mbs but I won't come close to that with my wimpy plan, so no worries. This is modem only, no routing capabilities, but I already had a router for wireless and it hooked right up. Supplied Cat5e Ethernet cable is about 6-inches long so nearly useless... most people have these laying around in bundles though, as I did, so no biggy for me. Seemed to be the best value in my research so I'd recommend it to get rid of that terrible $10 rental charge!
customer_reviews.author: Marty_5000

customer_reviews.title: Compact design, impressive performance.
customer_reviews.text: I decided to buy here an upgraded router due to periodic buffering (especially annoying when watching live TV on the Sling TV App). Reading a lot of reviews on Amazon, I decided to purchase this product to upgrade my cable modem as well. It was simplicity itself to connect and set up. I am very impressed with the compact design and overall quality. Over the last few days my choice of new router and modem has provided trouble-free, buffering-free and very impressive performance. Great purchase(s) all around. Thanks Amazon reviewers!
customer_reviews.author: Christian Philipp

customer_reviews.title: Full speed from a smaller modem
customer_reviews.text: Works with Wave Broadband. I get full 100 Mbps down load speed they offered. Indicator lights are handy. First two days the W/DS "indicates a bonded (multi-channel) connection" light would go OFF and the D/S "indicates a non-bonded (single channel)" light would go on instead. Download speed dropped to about 25 Mbps then. Checked using Speedtest.net. I would get back to full speed by power cycling the ON/OFF switch on the modem and have in sync to W/DS ON again. This may not be the modems fault - could have been the ISP. Only happened twice. Been solid ON for the W/DS and full speed since then - about three months.
customer_reviews.author: J C

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, fast, worked out of the box. Cox took 40 minutes to hook up (the person was a bit new) Apparently they need to issue an internal COX serial number. She didn't know this and kept trying to enter the Dlink SN. Then she had to ask her supervisor and within 2 minutes it was up and working. I'm thinking CoX doesn't teach their agents this to trouble people not to install their own modems. (just a tip! ) Connected it up to an old Wireless N router i had sitting in the garage. Bam! worked.
customer_reviews.author: Dionisio L Yang

customer_reviews.title: Great modem for the money
customer_reviews.text: This modem was a great replacement for our old Ubee DVW3201 from Time Warner. That modem had issues, and since majority of them are probably refurbished you're better off buying your own and saving money on that monthly fee anyways. Handles our 50/5 connection no problem. I highly recommend this for cable modem owners that are paying for a most likely defective modem. Once you get it all you have to do is call your cable provider and give them your modem details and you're good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Aron

customer_reviews.title: Bad power supply otherwise worked great.
customer_reviews.text: When it worked it was awesome. About a year into it's use the power supply up and quit. Couldn't find a replacement so was forced to purchase a new Cable Modem. Not worth the price for only 1 year use and warranty was expired.
customer_reviews.author: Infotekkie

customer_reviews.title: Says it’s COMCAST compatible and it does work w/ COMCAST but does not accept ANY upgrades
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a cheaper version of the modem my cable company wanted to sell or rent to me. Online it said that it would work with COMCAST but when I went to install it I had problems and called tech support. This modem was NOT on their “recommended” list but was compatible and we finally got it it to work. But I have not been able to install any upgrades. I tried calling CS but after a few months you have to pay for tech support so I ditched that idea. I will NOT be buying another D-Link modem. EVER.
customer_reviews.author: Truthful to a fault

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, consistent speed
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these in the past year. One for me and one for a family friend after I informed them its possible to buy your own modem and avoid Time Warner's modem lease fee. This works exactly as expected. On an ethernet connection I consistently get 95 mb/s Download speeds on my 100 mb/s account. This was cheaper than the comparable Motorola modems, and since I'm not planning on upgrading over 100 mb/s any time soon, this is exactly what I needed. My family friend has had hers for nearly a year and it is still going strong. I highly recommend this modem!
customer_reviews.author: Victor B

customer_reviews.title: Works great, TWC customer
customer_reviews.text: Works great. No issues. Much cheaper than paying Time Warner $8+/month to rent their stupid modem. Called them, gave them the MAC, connected almost instantly. I'm getting 1+MB upload and 3.5 MB download over wifi with it, (TWC first tier - advertised at 1MB up / 2MB down). Using it with this router:  And this splitter because I like to have the option to connect with ethernet cable (my laptop's wifi card gets weird sometimes):  No compatibility issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Not very reliable
customer_reviews.text: Needs to be rebooted frequently, at least twice a day, or else it will stop working. It doesn't lose its connection to the ISP, it just sort of stops sending any data. After a while, maybe five seconds, maybe a minute, it starts working again. Making matters worse, it can't be rebooted from the software interface - you have to physically push the reset button. This is a bargain price modem, but it isn't worth even that. Get something else.
customer_reviews.author: William T. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: D-Link = Good!
customer_reviews.text: This works great. Well, the first one I bought from Newegg last December stopped working after about a month and I still need to send it back under warranty. But I needed one right away, so I ordered another one from Amazon. It came quick, and has worked non-stop since day one. Much smarter then paying monthy rent to Comcast, those rip-off bastar$@. They pay their CEOs hundreds of thousands of dollars to sit around and think of ways to screw us customers. D-Link = Good. Comcast = Bad!
customer_reviews.author: Dudeboy 1959

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper alternatives are available
customer_reviews.text: Works well with TWC. When the installation guy arrived he said that docsis3 modems wouldn't work in Fairmont WV and that I needed a docsis2 modem. I found out after calling TWC that he didn't know what he was talking about I was able to get this one installed over the phone. Just fyi: the installation guy initially installed one of their docsis2 modems and it worked fine. But since I had a new modem I wanted it installed. You can buy one of the docsis2 modems on ebay used for cheap and it can handle up to 43mb. It was a Cisco model DPC2100R2. part number: 4012460.
customer_reviews.author: KevinR

customer_reviews.title: Cheap basic modem but it works
customer_reviews.text: Pretty basic but does the job. Works with comcast/xfinity in salt lake city, ut. On occasion the LAN cable loses connection. Tried different cables but it seems to be the port inside the unit is just a little wonky, for the price its not a huge deal for me. I just go give it a nudge and it's back in business.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew T

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied Sacramento User
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. This seems to run much more efficient than the $10/mo cable modem rental from xfinity. First speedtest clocked in over 85 Mbps. Easy set up, and configuration was simple to do from Comcast website to convert from their modem to your own cable modem.
customer_reviews.author: Vrossi32

customer_reviews.title: Just works
customer_reviews.text: I purchased it over 2 years ago when Cablevision introduced modem rental as separate $10 line item on my bill. This modem was cheapest DOSCIS 3.0 at the time (like $30). I installed, returned Cablevision modem and forgot about it since. By now it saved me over $250
customer_reviews.author: Shurak

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice Over ISP Hardware
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to test the assumption that using equipment other than what is provided by a cable ISP will achieve better Internet experience, without buying a higher-priced service package. Well, as you might expect, the assumption is correct. My experience has been very good on the basic level of service using this modem along with a decently rated wireless router (like those provided by D-Link). So I'm able to keep my service cost down and still get very good throughput for downloading and streaming. Love this choice.
customer_reviews.author: Cable ISP Customer

customer_reviews.title: Make sure to call cable company with MAC address & serial, etc
customer_reviews.text: Works just fine. Be sure and call your cable provider internet support with the MAC Address and Serial number and have them register it to your cable account and stay on the line with them while they do that and cycle the modem. Then all works fine and you're good to go. This increased our speed (on speedtest dot net) quite a bit by installing this and ditching back to comcast, the beat up old Arris one they supplied and charged us $10 a month for. The IP address for settings 192.168.100.1 and a few things were missing or finicky, but once ya know & figure it out and find info you need, it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: likeitis

customer_reviews.title: works great. Always have reservations about preowned items
customer_reviews.text: In a few words, works great. Always have reservations about preowned items, but im glad to have a modem that replaces my old out if date expensive rental, that ive been paying for with time warner, spectrum, for tooo long. * one tip, IF ANY ISP gives you a list if "suggested " compatible modems, remember, you are NOT limited to those.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Good speeds
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a new xfinity install to avoid the monthly rental charges. Other than a few hiccups in the install, it has worked reliably and I get better than advertised speeds for my plan. I still get weekly xfinity outages in my area, but that is not the modems fault.
customer_reviews.author: P. Lin

customer_reviews.title: High speed, quality
customer_reviews.text: Working with Spectrum. Solid design and simple. it just has to plug in and work. Don't overpay for such a simple function. Plugs into my linksys router and gives access to 3 computers, 5 cell phones, a TV, and 5 tablets.
customer_reviews.author: Kentucky J.C.

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PRICE...DOES WHAT IT'S SUPPOSED TO DO
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace the one I was renting from Cox Cable when I figured out that I had spent $400 so far for a freaking modem! And if I kept renting, I'd be paying even more for an OLD used modem!! Easy to set up, and works like a charm and it doesn't cost me $8 a month.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Works fine now...but had trouble with my Apple Time Capsule at first.
customer_reviews.text: I would have put it a 5-star but I have problems with my Apple Time Capsule when I replaced my cable model. I have since fixed the problem, but for some reason it did something to the wifi and wouldn't let me use more than 1 device at a time (I have 5). Now that we figured out that we needed to "re-set" my Time Capsule to it's factory settings, it seems to be working fine...but it took many hours on the phone with the cable company and D-Link before the problem was finally solved by a cable technician that came out to my home.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa F

customer_reviews.title: plug it in and forget it
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. This cable modem is fast, and has no problems handling our 100 mbps connection. We have topped out at 120 mbps over ethernet. It is also reliable. We have not had to reset it for the six months we've had it. Set up was as simple as calling Spectrum and activating the code.
customer_reviews.author: John C

customer_reviews.title: Product did NOT work..... Returned.
customer_reviews.text: Did not work... returned it and purchased the Arris that works great. My ISP (TWC) said they have a lot of problems the D-Link modem....
customer_reviews.author: No name

customer_reviews.title: Comcast technician didn't exactly like it and in fact said it was NOT compatible
customer_reviews.text: No problem setting up from my side. Comcast technician didn't exactly like it and in fact said it was NOT compatible. I told him I had spent upwards of 5 days reading reviews on cable modems and that other Comcast technicians had no problems activating this modem, which was a prime reason I selected this one. The Comcast technician was then able to activate it within 10 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Vance

customer_reviews.title: Fast and reliable
customer_reviews.text: Never had any issues with this modem on Cox, Comcast, or Spectrum. Gigibait port going to my SOHO router has been reliable and trouble free since day one. The web portal access to this modem is simple and straight forward. I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: ninja_hamster

customer_reviews.title: Easy plug and play
customer_reviews.text: Excellen product. Was able to replace the cable modem I was renting from Comcast. I was paying 10 dollars a month for the rental. Now this device will pay for itself in a few more months and save me money going forward. Easy plug and play. I just had to contact Comcast and give them the information from the bottom of the product. The item give me slightly faster speeds than the modem I was renting. It could probably go faster but that is probably limited by the ISP.
customer_reviews.author: XswooshSQ

customer_reviews.title: Painless setup, works great!
customer_reviews.text: Setting this modem up couldn't have been easier. Just literally plug it in and you're up and running! I was replacing a leased modem with this purchased modem; I have an Earthlink account, which is provided and billed by Time Warner Cable. The leased modem they had provided was a Ubee brand. I unplugged the old modem, plugged this one in, called Time Warner to give them its MAC address (located on the bottom of the modem), they activated it, and that was that. Absolutely painless. So far so good. For the price, I think this is a very good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Agatha Coronado

customer_reviews.title: i get my full speed with comcast on this modem ...
customer_reviews.text: i get my full speed with comcast on this modem. my subcription is 100mbps download, and i get exactly that.
customer_reviews.author: Seraphim

customer_reviews.title: Works for Optimum 60/25
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Speeds as advertised. Optimum internet - 60/25
customer_reviews.author: Andrew C.

customer_reviews.title: I am glad I bought this.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this when my previous modem died on us. Our old modem was continuously giving a lot of problems (on and off intermittently) and we were really tired of it. We've called our service provided a number of times and could not figure out the problem but with this modem, we never have any issues now other than occasional connection issues that are from the service provider and not due to modem. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: NK Pati

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This modem has worked wonderfully so far. Just plug and play. Though it took me some time to find the coaxial outlet that had internet connectivity in my apartment (only one of three outlets did, and the one that did was somewhat hidden), once I found the proper outlet simply screwing the coaxial cable into the modem and plugging in the power cable got everything working great. This is a much better alternative to renting a modem from your cable company and this modem will work with all the major providers so it will ultimately save you money. No complaints thus far!
customer_reviews.author: Eric Chavez

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and works flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: We've been using this for more than three years now and it's performed flawlessly with our xfinity internet service. Our service is nominally 100 mbps, and speed tests consistently measure just above 100. (If you have really fast service, perhaps above about 250 Mbps, then you will probably want to get a faster modem.) Far more economical than paying to rent a modem from Comcast.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Must of bought a lemmon
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about 4 weeks. Now it appears to be frequently over heating. Ambient room temps are 75-80degF. Modem placed in open air, nothing including dust is blocking the vents. Attempting to return through DLINK. Update:DLINK was very efficient in providing a replacement modem. However, it took two days longer than my return window of the Netgear replacement modem I bought at Best Buy. I now have a new spare modem still in original packing.
customer_reviews.author: Violet Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy used electronics on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I bought a used-one from Amazon Warehouse and the modem's mac number is used by a different user on Comcast. It is good as a stolen property! I cannot use it with Comcast even though I legally bought from Amazon Warehouse! Now the return window has lapsed and I am stuck with a useless piece and lost money!
customer_reviews.author: Ranil

customer_reviews.title: Does everything it is supposed to. Comcast approved.
customer_reviews.text: Does everything it is supposed to. Comcast approved. I was paying $12 a month for a rental and finally purchased this for $39
customer_reviews.author: B.P.K.

customer_reviews.title: Saving Money and Getting Faster Performance
customer_reviews.text: Saving $5.99 per month and getting better performance. I just received this modem and hooked it up. Right out of the box I'm getting much faster download/upload speeds. Take a look at my screen shots.
customer_reviews.author: JDub

customer_reviews.title: Easy to connect and works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Got this instead of renting from Comcast, which is a rip off. Easy to connect and works as expected. Just make sure to tell your cable/internet company your MAC address
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: It is so nice to not have to pay Comcast modem rental! Pretty easy to set up, and has worked like a dream.
customer_reviews.author: Shandra

customer_reviews.title: A bit of a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I find the web interface and diagnostic capabilities of this device somewhat deficient (don't look for an events log for any indication of channel status) and the web interface is about worthless. In addition, customer service at D-Link seems a bit lacking. I think the bottom line for the price is based entirely upon the rental fee the ISPs charge.
customer_reviews.author: D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: RELIABLE, works with Comcast
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because my Motorola Surfboard was flaky. Basically, I wanted to buy something that wasn't a Motorola because of just bad experience with their stuff over the last few years. The D-Link unit solved a number of lost connection issues that I was having with other equipment. Now, the only time that Comcast is out is when Comcast has an actual issue. In a word, this item is RELIABLE. I've been running it for a couple months now and I'm very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: No More Rent to TWC
customer_reviews.text: Up and running for about 2 weeks, easy installation. Had to call Time Warner and give them the MAC address, after that it was just a matter of hooking up the wi-fi. 100 down and 25 up, about half that with wi-fi (4 devices running). I was using a TWC wi-fi modem and they were charging me $12 for the modem and $8 for the wi-fi. This modem will pay for itself in 6 months or so.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its a winner.!
customer_reviews.text: Original Review on :: February 11, 2015 This modem worked Great, right out of the box. Easy setup & good clean look .. its nice when the inside matches the outside.!! Followup Review on :: August 6, 2016 Well, its been doing its job really well for over a year now. Sometimes, nothing new to report can actually be a good testimonial (IMHO) so.. I'd still gladly recommend this cable modem.
customer_reviews.author: Myrddin R Emrys

customer_reviews.title: ... product gets a 1 star because it stopped performing like it should after the warranty expires
customer_reviews.text: This product gets a 1 star because it stopped performing like it should after the warranty expires. I've had this product for 6 months and it worked fine for 5 months. Last month I started experiencing sporadic internet connection with this modem. About every hour the modem lights will start blinking and I'll lose internet connection. It'll last about 5 minutes then the internet connection comes back on. This happens every hour and is very frustrating when watching shows. I've tried the reset button and it still has the same problem. This product is very unreliable. Would not purchase again. I'm about to throw it out the window and get a different modem.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend purchasing the equipment as paying this rental fee certainly ...
customer_reviews.text: This modem has paid for itself as it was Time Warner Cable compatible and since we now own it we are not required to pay the rent fee to the company to borrow it. I highly recommend purchasing the equipment as paying this rental fee certainly adds up over time!! The transition was seamless, just consult Time Warner's website for instructions and compatibility information. Only wish I bought it sooner!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish the LEDs would flicker to show data usage flowing through it
customer_reviews.text: Except for more desire for more informative LEDs, I can't complain. It's been rock solid in using with Comcast. I subscribe to their 16Mbps (Performance Internet) service, which you would think would be not too much of a challenge. But I have had issues with other cable modems.
customer_reviews.author: djrichard

customer_reviews.title: Feels a little lighter than previous modem but works well
customer_reviews.text: Works much better than my previous modem with similar specifications. Wi-Fi signal is just a strong but speed has improved
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: installation was easy.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced an older modem and router to take advantage of upgraded service speed. This helped, although not as much as I'd hoped (the reason for 4 stars instead of 5). I ran a speedtest before and after installing this and a TP-Link TL-WR841N router. Before: 6-7 MPS download, 4-5 MBS upload. After: 15-32 MBS download, 6-7 MBS upload. A noticeable improvement, but less than the 50/25 MBS our service provide says we should get. Still, for $99 for both pieces of equipment, the upgrade was worth it. The modem had to be registered with our service provider (COX), but other than that, installation was easy.
customer_reviews.author: Gene Shuman

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the leased modem.
customer_reviews.text: Far superior to the modem I was leasing from Time Warner. Internet speed has increased. This might also be due to Time Warner switching to Spectrum, but who knows. I'd like to think it's the modem.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Great!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fast! Wish I would of bought it sooner instead of giving all that money to Time Warner for renting their modem! I think the build quality is very good and I had it working within 10 minutes of plugging it in. (I had to call Time Warner for them to activate the new modem on their network but it was quick and easy)
customer_reviews.author: Thunder

customer_reviews.title: Great modem
customer_reviews.text: I bought this modem in an attempt to save a little money with Time Warner Cable. Having been a customer of theirs for the past 7 years, I probably could have bought a dozen of these after paying the rental fee. This modem was very easy to set up, and has been working great. If you have Timer Warner, this is a great modem.
customer_reviews.author: LMADAMS

customer_reviews.title: Simple, basic, inexpensive and great performance.
customer_reviews.text: I received this cable modem yesterday and put it online. In my testing so far its performance exceeds the cable modem provided by the cable company, Very simple, straightforward user interface. No frills, few settings, exactly what I need before going into my router.
customer_reviews.author: neast70

customer_reviews.title: Tripled my speed
customer_reviews.text: This is a great piece of equipment. I installed it within five minutes. It replaces a 9 year old motorola modem supplied by TWC. The speed has tripled and I will break even on the cost in 9 months. I did have to call TWC to give them the MAC address. that look five times longer than hooking up the modem. One point: USPS delivered this modem and jammed it in my mailbox. Half of it was sticking out into the street and people wonder why UPS is in business.
customer_reviews.author: Judith Taylor

customer_reviews.title: discontinued support by d-link
customer_reviews.text: half of a year into owning this product, i found out it's support was to be discontinued by d-link. Which was a shame, because it was the only product of theirs with my ISP (Cox) that was to support the DIR-2680 router i had foolishly invested in. Poor show, d-link.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan B

customer_reviews.title: So far so good. Out the box it is 6-8Mbps faster than ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Out the box it is 6-8Mbps faster than the Arris crap from the cable company that was resetting itself 5-6 times a day.
customer_reviews.author: Just a guy

customer_reviews.title: Great for COX
customer_reviews.text: Great replacement for COX, over their 10 a month rental.
customer_reviews.author: goldbond70

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: I just installed this item in my home as a replacement for the one I was "leasing" from Time Warner. Works great; no issues! The only con is the set up. On the Time Warner website it made it sound like I could just set this up on line however it wouldn't work for me. I called Time Warner (on a Sunday morning) and they were very helpful and had us up & running in less than 10 minutes. Worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Albert

customer_reviews.title: Stop paying the cable company!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic little rig. Better models exist, especially with a combined wireless router feature. This is the best affordable one to help ya stop paying the cable company though. As far as i can tell it works for every single major cable company network.
customer_reviews.author: Evan Stapp

customer_reviews.title: We’ve worked with D-Link support and our ISP provider to ...
customer_reviews.text: We’ve worked with D-Link support and our ISP provider to no avail with this unit, it’s slow and has to be reset consistently to keep our network speed from stalling constantly.
customer_reviews.author: Luz T.

customer_reviews.title: I've only had the modem for a few days, ...
customer_reviews.text: I've only had the modem for a few days, but it automatically registered itself with Comcast as soon as it was connected, and its working perfectly so far. I subscribed to Comcast 75 Mb/second Internet only service, and so far I'm consistently getting between 85 and 90 Mb/second download and between six and seven 7 Mb/second upload speeds.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Works with CableVision optimum online NY/NJ
customer_reviews.text: Whats not to like, a steal compared to renting a 10$/month modem, and works with CableVison optimum online NY/NJ despite not being on their official list of 3 supported modems.
customer_reviews.author: cyber kid

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price and good performance
customer_reviews.text: Great price and it connects as well as the more expensive Surfboard that failed after a year. Using Comcast I download ~ 125 mbps and upload ~ 10 mbps. It was slower for the first 2 days, and then no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Essex

customer_reviews.title: ... with Cox and Comcast as we move and got good reviews. Still works well
customer_reviews.text: Purchased because it would work with Cox and Comcast as we move and got good reviews. Still works well, but tends to drop signal and say no connection unless signal is strong and steady--oversensitive to signal issues or weakness.
customer_reviews.author: Nonya

customer_reviews.title: Worked great until...
customer_reviews.text: Was great for 2-1/2 years. Now I must reboot daily and the connection speed has slowed way down. Comcast is now telling me the device only supports 150 Mbps, which is odd because for the first 2-1/2 years it averaged around 260 Mbps. I'm sure Comcast/Xfinity wouldn't mess with my signal... ;(
customer_reviews.author: PanaMax

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: As far as things that you'll never notice working, it works.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Easy installation, very stable
customer_reviews.text: Happily paid the monthly rent for an outdated Motorola Surfboard until the modem randomly froze several times a day. This DOCSIS 3.0 modem was on Brighthouse Network's approved modem list, had decent reviews and had current firmware. Easy to install and Brighthouse provisioned over the phone in less than 10 minutes. No improvement in speed, but software/firmware is more stable.
customer_reviews.author: Eighth Samurai

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and good
customer_reviews.text: Great basic modem. This saves me $12 a month from my internet company. Keep in mind that this has speed limits I have 300mbps internet speed and this works fine. It does NOT have WiFi, but I was using my own anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Kmagn13

customer_reviews.title: It's a cable modem.
customer_reviews.text: It took about 15 minutes for Comcrap to get their shizz in order and recognize this modem. Other than that I've had no issues with it. And it costs less than 6 months of modem rental from the devil company.
customer_reviews.author: Mallowpufft

customer_reviews.title: Glad I made the investment!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this modem with time warner cable' 100 mbps Internet for over a year. The best thing about it is that I never have to think about it because it just always works. We're using this modem with the ASUS RT‐N66U Wireless Router and once we set it up we've had no problems since!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: Works fabulously, saves me money, and is not quite as ugly as the one I gave back to TWC.
customer_reviews.text: So far, saving me loads of money vs. "leasing" one from Tme Warner. Works at least as well as the TW-provided one I had been using. Caveat: I did have to make a call to TWC tech support for them to flip a couple of switches to get this thing activated or whatever. But that was fairly painless.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: A Decent Work horse
customer_reviews.text: Been working great with Comcast since Feb 2016. Usually if there is a speed or connectivity problem it turns out to be related to a storm or workers fixing something within the neighborhood.. All I would have to do is reboot the modem and I am good. Never had any real outages with this device. A+
customer_reviews.author: Matt & Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Ethernet Port and Bad Connectivity
customer_reviews.text: This modem caused me all kind of havoc. It constantly and inconsistently lost connection with my ISP (Wide Open West). the Ethernet port was also faulty and would only work if the cable was pulled in a certain direction. I tried different things for a week before giving up and returning it.
customer_reviews.author: irocz8292

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working 7 months after buying. Tech came out and confirmed. Frustrating to buy brand new and it doesn’t even last a year. Waste of money, but even worse the time it’s taken to work with cable company and taking off work to be home for that.
customer_reviews.author: B. Bluml

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with my service provider. Was easy to set up. Has never needed to be rebooted or had any problems in 8 continuous months of service.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan J. Ischo

customer_reviews.title: Works just as good or better than the modem provided by Time Warner ...
customer_reviews.text: Works just as good or better than the modem provided by Time Warner Cable. It's a great price and will pay for itself in 4 months.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Lavender

customer_reviews.title: Money Saver.
customer_reviews.text: Saving me $10 a month with Time Warner Cable. Easy setup. Simply call TWC and they will walk you thru the setup. You need to provide them with the MAC address on bottom of item. Works well with my Dlink DIR 655 wireless router.
customer_reviews.author: iheartmykids

customer_reviews.title: 2 Thumbs Up!
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly with Comcast - had no issues whatsoever. So long rental fee - makes cutting the cord even sweeter!
customer_reviews.author: cheft

customer_reviews.title: Works great, saves money
customer_reviews.text: This modem is working flawlessly and replaced the TWC rental unit. In 4 months the savings will pay for this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Charlieg

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect with Time Warner Cable
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect with Time Warner Cable. Cheap upgrade for my older cable modem to allow me the 50mbps download speed.
customer_reviews.author: Brent Wong

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: I used to buy nothing but Linksys by Cisco but now I have switched to D-Link and saved about 20% or more in cost. The performance is identical and I have not had a D-Link product fail in 4 years so far. (I have had to replace failed Linksys products before)
customer_reviews.author: Boat Boy

customer_reviews.title: This modem plays nicely with my D-Link wireless router
customer_reviews.text: This modem plays nicely with my D-Link wireless router, which I can't say for the modem that Time Warner Cable had provided. That one caused my connectivity to be up and down all day, and my wireless multifunction device stopped working completely. All problems were solved with the DCM-301. It was also a piece of cake to install, I just had to call Time Warner to provide the MAC address.
customer_reviews.author: craiginnyc

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment
customer_reviews.text: Modem worked fine for a year before it started intermittently resetting itself. Naturally this occurred immediately after the warranty expired. I spoke with my ISP multiple times over the last six months since the issue first occurred and they reported zero issues in the area. It's clearly a hardware issue and now I must replace it. I would not recommend this model unless you purchase Amazons extended 2 year warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Minor

customer_reviews.title: Plug & Play?  No.
customer_reviews.text: Modem did not connect to the internet after following instructions and registering product with ISP. Upon switching back to ISP-provided modem, internet connection was re-established. Swapped back to D-Link modem to double check - still no connection, despite it being registered properly with ISP. Switched back to ISP-provided modem and internet connection was established again. I am now promptly returning this modem.
customer_reviews.author: Troy D.

customer_reviews.title: Works with Optimum
customer_reviews.text: Hooked up for optimum yesterday. Seems to be a tad bit faster than the leased modem. Super easy to setup. Been using for two weeks now and no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Wojciech Brynczka

customer_reviews.title: works with my major cable company and works great. Haven't reset it once
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so I dont have to rent one from the cable company at 8 dollars a month. Within 7 months this will pay for its self. Stop renting things from cable companies its a rip off. This is cheap, works with my major cable company and works great. Haven't reset it once.
customer_reviews.author: fruitpunch78

customer_reviews.title: Decent home modem at an affordable price
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of paying monthly rental fees to my ISP for use of their modem. Bought this, sent them the MAC, and haven't had an issue with the modem since install. I would recommend it if you're looking for a decent, bare-bones home modem at an affordable price.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm and was able to RETURN my "rented" ...
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm and was able to RETURN my "rented" modem, sick of paying them for the last 6 years when I didn't have to. I purchase a cheap refurb of this off Amazon from a marketplace seller, and wasn't sorry for it. I'll make my money back in 5 months from owning my own modem.
customer_reviews.author: Ragnar Danneskjöld

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It works and it came in on time. Make sure to check your ISP's approved and compatible list. update 4/6/2016 has overheating issues, mainly noticed with large pipe domains like trying to work with large files on google, device will overheat, connection will be lost, device must be unplugged and cooled off, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, quick, and easy.
customer_reviews.text: Just had for a day, but wanted to let anyone considering buying that it definitely works with Optimum. Hooked it up and Optimum's network recognized that it was a new modem and walked me through the CMAC registration process. So far, faster than the default Arris modem that I had.
customer_reviews.author: B. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Solid piece of hardware.
customer_reviews.text: Has survived straight 3 months of torture with zero issues. Might update after a while if anything comes up. 5 stars so far.The heck with paying a rental fee to your internet provider if you can buy your own.Pays itself after a year.
customer_reviews.author: Javier Barajas

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, got this to stop paying the rental fee ...
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, got this to stop paying the rental fee from Comcast on my old router, works great no issues
customer_reviews.author: Jaime P.

customer_reviews.title: For the price, this a great value Docis 3.0 modem
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded my Hawaiian Oceanic Time Warner Cable internet and this Docis 3.0 Modem was on their approved list. It installed perfectly and was authorized within 10 minutes after the Time Warner Tech called in the MAC address. Speeds are good and so far zero drops or problems. Great value Docis 3.0 modem.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great modem, works with TWC.
customer_reviews.text: It helps me save on the modem lease (which TWC said was going up the next month). It works as it should, haven't had any issues yet. Also the LEDs don't blink activity like the old modem did, not so distracting that way.
customer_reviews.author: wihzkid

customer_reviews.title: Excellent modem
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on sale easy setup! I didn't even call Time Warner I did it through their chat feature. Took 10 minutes to set up. Highly recommend!!!
customer_reviews.author: EL_SuPerbOBo

product_meta.title: D-Link DOCSIS 3.0 Cable Modem (DCM-301) Compatible with Comcast Xfinity, Time Warner Cable, Charter, Cox, Cablevision, and More
product_meta.description: The D-Link DCM-301 cable modem is powered by the DOCSIS 3.0 channel bonding technology that provides download speeds up to 8 times faster than DOCSIS 2.0, making it easier to enjoy your favorite Internet applications, such as file sharing, audio and video streaming, Internet TV and website browsing. The DCM-301 is compatible with major US cable providers, including Comcast, Time Warner and more. Save money by eliminating monthly rental fees. The D-Link DCM-301 delivers always on and always connected Internet access - ideal for residential and business connectivity.
feature_bullets: Compatible with Comcast Xfinity, Time Warner Cable, Charter, Cox, Cablevision, and more; Requires Cable Internet Service
Not compatible with: Verizon, AT&T, or CenturyLink
Maximum downstream speeds: 30 Mbps (640QAM) / 43 Mbps (256QAM) / up to 320 Mbps through 8 channel bonding1; Maximum upstream speeds: 30 Mbps (TDMA) / 35 Mbps (SCDMA) / up to 160 Mbps1
Compatible with major US cable providers, including Comcast, Time Warner and more
Up to 8 times faster than DOCSIS 2.0 with speeds of up to 343Mbps. DOCIS 3.0 compliant

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars669 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
